result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay T. White Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 2 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes: The $270.00 assessment is a cost that is joint and several with co-defendant Nathan Vanzile (15CF110) and is to be paid at no less than $100.00/month commencing upon release from incarceration.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.

The defendant may not have any contact with Nathan Jerome Vanzile (DOB: 6/18/86).

The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.

The defendant must take all medications as prescribed.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week.

The defendant must continue with all counseling and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Huber alloeed for child care only if jail allows - and if not allowed, the defendant will have to petition the court to amend and the court will decide at that time.

Eligible for community service under 973.03(3).

supervisions.notes:

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jay T. White in court with attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve.  Defendant Jay T. White in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:35 AM. Called 15CF41 and 15CF109. Verhove has revocation summary, no inaccuracies or inconsistencies. Court reviews ROAW. Court and counsel go thru credit, 2 days on 15CF109 and 51 days on 15CF41. State makes final argument prior to his recommendation - recommends on both counts of 15CF109 - 6 years in WI State Prison System concurrent to each other but consecutive to any other sentence he is currently serving, consisting of 3 years of intial confinement followed by 3 years of ES; on 15CF41 - count #1 - 9 months in FC jail, count #3 - 3.5 years in WI State Prison System, concurrent to count #1 and to 15CF109 but consecutive to any other sentence he is currently serving. VerHoeve makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 1 year in FC jail and be allowed to serve some of that time in inpatient treatment program. White makes statement. Court has questions in regards to the credit that has been calculated. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF109 - #1 - 5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES -  consecutive to any other sentence (13CF141), #3 - 5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - concurrent to count #1 but consecutivce to any other sentence (13CF141); on 15CF41 - count #1 - 9 months in FC jail - concurrent with 15CF109 but consecutive to any other sentence(13CF141); #3 - 3 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - concurrent to count #1 and to 15CF109 but consecutive to any other sentence(13CF141), submit DNA sample, not sure if he is eligible for programs but will make him eligible for programs, credit on 15CF109 of 324 days, credit for 103 days on 15CF41, turn unpaid fines into civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 30, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 23, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Clerk contacted FOSO to inform defendant to contact SPD, Clerk also sent ROAW to SPD

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jay T. White in court with attorney David V. Penn.  Defendant Jay T. White in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:18 PM. State - resolved - plead G to count #1 as alleged and to count #3 as alleged, remaining counts DRI, joint recommendation of 5 years probation on both counts - concurrent to each other, count #1 - 365 days jail, court costs on each count, AODA and follow thru, re-pay $270.00 to FC Drug Task Force ($200 is joint and several with co-defendant - Nathan Jerome Vanzile) and to be paid at no less than $100.00/month upon release from incarceration, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns or similar establishments, take all medications as prescribed, employment/school, 200 hours of community service total, no contact with Nathan Jerome Vanzile (DOB 6/18/86). Penn and White agree but adds that the DA is not going to charge the defendant on his new probable cause that has been received. State agrees that he will not be charging the defendant with additional charges from probable caus. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #4 and #5. White pleads G to counts #1 and #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Penn makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asking for 7-10 days to report for stated reasons. White makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 5 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: count #1 - 365 days in FC jail - huber allowed -(child care only if jail allows. If not allowed will have to petition court to amend and court will decide at that time) -eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - report by 8:30 AM on 10/30/15, 200 hours of community service, AODA and follow thru, re-pay $270.00 to FC Drug Task Force ($200 is joint and several with co-defendant - Nathan Jerome Vanzile) and to be paid at no less than $100.00/month upon release from incarceration, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns or similar establishments, attend at least 1 AA meeting per week, continue with all counseling and follow thru, employment/school, 200 hours of community service total, take all medications as presciribed, no contact with Nathan Jerome Vanzile (DOB 6/18/86), costs on each count including DNA surcharge - paid thru probation; count #2 - same conditions as count #1 except no additional jail or community service, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, submit DNA sample, 2 days credit if revoked, right to appeal. Court vacates bond on FOSO 15-17509 and State will not be charging on it.

Defendant Jay T. White in court with attorney David V. Penn.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:12 PM. State here for PH, in anticipation of waiver, has filed information which mirrors complaint. Penn provides court with waiver of PH form. Court goes over form and finds defendant is freely and voluntarily waiving his right to PH. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Proceed to ARGN. Penn has information and waives further reading and enters NG pleas on all counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Jay T. White in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:35 PM. State - defendant picked up due to complaint filed with warrant. White has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. White understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney - believes he will be hiring David Penn, states there is not a PO hold at this point. Court instructs regarding SPD or court appointed attorney. State - bond - $2000.00 cash bond. White - bond - asks for signature bond. Court - bond - $5000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, advised to contact Attorney Penn right away, gives ramifications of appearing without an attorney.  Clerk faxed FOSO bond to be signed, court appointed attorney form and notice of hearing. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
